thread.title: Lockdowns lifted at Fredericton schools after report of teen with gun
thread.title_full: Lockdowns lifted at Fredericton schools after report of teen with gun | CP24.com

author: The Canadian Press
title: Lockdowns lifted at Fredericton schools after report of teen with gun
text:
FREDERICTON -- Police in Fredericton lifted lockdowns today at all schools in a section of the city after receiving a report of a teenaged male carrying a firearm.
Police spokeswoman Alycia Bartlett says police received information around 9 a.m. about a teenaged male, dressed in dark clothing, carrying a firearm in a gun sock.
At least four schools including a high school and an elementary school were initially locked down as a precaution, but shortly before noon police lifted the lockdowns.
The police department did not elaborate on why the lockdowns had been lifted in a message it posted via its Twitter account, which also carried a photo of a person of interest in the incident.
There was a strong police presence in the areas of Priestman, York and Smythe streets.
Police said other schools in the area had been secured for precautionary reasons.
"We realize that during incidents like these the public's worry and concern can be significantly heightened," the police department said on its Facebook page. "Police are taking a measured approach to deal with this situation."
Police said they were using a number of their resources in their search.
"We have not received any additional information about a threat aside from the initial complaint that came in this morning," it says.
